*[Bug 16156] Reorder the three first lines of R --version [WISH]*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16156>

Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |michaelchirico4@gmail.com

--- Comment #1 from Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) ---
Created attachment 3332
  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3332&action=edit>
Switch order of Copyright and Platform entries to R --version

Adding the patch for this at least, I'll leave it up to maintainers whether to
accept or to close the issue :)

text:
*[Bug 15897] index(): Extend names() functionality to allow non-character data types*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=15897>

Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |michaelchirico4@gmail.com

--- Comment #1 from Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) ---
I think this bug can be closed, it would be a really deep change to how R works
to support this. I suspect interested users can use object systems (S4,R6,R7)
to accomplish this instead for their use case.

text:
*[Bug 15652] Wishlist: warn user when .Rbuildignore omits files*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=15652>

Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |michaelchirico4@gmail.com

--- Comment #4 from Michael Chirico (<mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>) ---
This still seems like it would be useful. Here's where the exclusion happens:

<https://github.com/r-devel/r-svn/blob/3cbe3848e6f06e133dbd9ec6057e6817acb43d18/src/library/tools/R/build.R#L1094>

We can add a `printLog()` there but that will blow up the generally concise
info printed to console in normal `R CMD build`; I agree a new `--verbose`
option would be more appropriate, which could more generally add a lot more
detail to the `R CMD build` output.
